questions.question: Are all probes identified, or provide traceability to, part number, frequency, coil diameter, probe type (array, differential, absolute, etc) and if the probe coil is shielded or unshielded?
Is a magnetometer/residual field indicator(s), used to verify demagnetization, available?
questions.guidance: Guidance: If ferrous materials/parts are not Eddy Current inspected, answer NA.

questions.question: Is there a procedure, general or specific, for processing and inspection using the Eddy Current Testing method?
Does the procedure(s) have traceability to the name and address of the facility performing inspection?
Does the procedure(s) indicate approval by the applicable Level 3?
Does the procedure(s) have an identification number and the date the procedure was approved?
A requirement that all personnel are qualified and certified to the required level for the activity undertaken and the applicable contract requirements?
Type of records and description for the method of identifying inspection status?
Method for control of software or programming used for automated processing equipment as applicable?
The part number, material, alloy, type relevant to the material/part to be examined?
The equipment to be used for inspection, including manufacturer and model number?
The frequency, coil diameter, shielded/un-shielded, type and part number of probes used?
The reference standard identification?
The reference standard and material/part demagnetization requirements?
The use of magnetic field indicators to verify demagnetization?
If residual magnetism is present, the material/part(s) are to be demagnetized and re-inspected?
Address or provide traceability to customer acceptance criteria?
The required standardization parameters?
The minimum signal to noise ratio?
Sketches, photos, chart or procedure indicating area and coverage and/or orientation of the material/part?
The internal filter setting used?
The external filter setting used?
The inspection index increments, scan speed and inspection coverage verification method used?
The acceptance requirements to be used for evaluating indications and disposition of part(s) after examination?
That the system is checked at the beginning of the examination, then after 4 hours, at the end of the shift, at the end of the lot or at the end of the inspection?
That the system is checked whenever there is a change in equipment or accessories or whenever there are changes in the electrical power supply that affect the Eddy Current examination?
If there is an equipment malfunction, that the equipment is repaired or replaced and the entire lot re-inspected?
The method for the control of software or programming used for automated processing equipment as applicable?
Does the standardization reflect the requirements given in the technique?
Is the surface roughness of the standard such that the Subscriber customer required defect signal to noise ratio is maintained?
Are the inspection scanning parameters used to inspect material/parts the same as those used on the reference standard?
Do the ends of the probes employ a protective barrier to eliminate scratches on parts under inspection; e.g., teflon tape, etc. as required by the Subscriber customer's specification?
Is the lift-off distance between the probe and material/part, as required by the approved technique, the same as the standardization as listed in paragraph 5.1.1?
If bolt hole probes, encircling and/or inside diameter coils are used, is the fill factor between probes and material/parts within +/-10% of the reference standard as listed in paragraph 5.1.1?

Is the system checked at the beginning of the examination, whenever there is a change in equipment or accessories, whenever there are changes in the electrical power supply that affect the Eddy Current examination, after 4 hours, at the end of the shift, at the end of the lot or at the end of the inspection?
For automated systems is the system standardized in accordance with the Subscriber customer requirements?
The Hall Effect meters shall be calibrated at a minimum of three points each dynamic range and each polarity in addition to zero?
The Hall Effect meters are calibrated at least semi-annually?
Is there evidence of compliance to the procedure and are records of this test on file and do they indicate that the calibration is current?
The Eddy Current instrument shall hold a calibration certificate or metrology verification?
The Eddy Current instrument shall be calibrated or checked by metrology at least annually?
Is there evidence of compliance to the procedure and are records of this test on file and do they indicate that the calibration / metrology certificate is current?
That documentation is available for all reference standards fabricated in accordance with Subscriber specifications or referenced standards?
For special standards, the standard is comparable to the component being inspected, including surface finish?
That manufacturing documentation of the reference standards shall be available for review?
That all standards are clearly identified as to material type, notch size, depth, etc. or traceable to documentation with noted requirements?
The bearing reference standard shall be representative of the configuration being inspected, per technique/procedure?
That reference/calibration standards are stored and handled to prevent damage from mishandling, corrosion, pitting, etc.?
Is there evidence of compliance to the procedure and are records of this test on file and do they indicate acceptable results?
Compliance
Customer:
Subscriber / End User:
Purchase Order Number:
Work Order Number:
Lot / Batch / Serial Number:
Process Specification(s) / Revision(s):
Internal Procedure(s) / Revision(s):
Acceptance Specification / Drawing Notes (including Revision level; Class and/or Grade if applicable):
Part Description:
Part Number / Revision:
Inspectors / Level(s):
Is the inspector wearing vision correction as required?
Equipment / Tool ID:
Is the facility using the appropriate specifications and revisions as required by the contract document?
If the facility is working to any deviations, have they been approved by the customer?
Were the applicable requirements, procedures and acceptance criteria made available to the Eddy Current inspectors?
If written procedures, and or techniques, require review and/or approval by the Cognizant Engineering Organization(Subscriber Customer), is that approval evident?
If applicable, are part specific drawing inspection and/or acceptance notes being flowed down and followed by the inspectors?
Was there evidence of compliance to the document control procedure?
If applicable, are all specifications, drawings, procedures or technique changes authorized?
Are Eddy Current inspections appropriately performed on 100% of the material/parts or is a sampling plan utilized?
If sampling plans are utilized, have they been approved by the customer?
Part number / Material Identification?
Process specification and revision?
Acceptance criteria specification and revision?
Correct sequence of operations?
Did the inspector review the applicable specification(s), technique sheet, and/or procedure(s) prior to inspecting the material/part?
Was the material or part(s) checked for a residual magnetic field prior to the inspection? And if so, were they demagnetized if required?

If ferromagnetic material or parts were inspected, was the reference standard, material or part properly demagnetized prior to inspection to ensure that a magnetic field of 1 gauss or less was present when tested with a residual field indicator (magnetometer)?
Does the Eddy Current equipment support the frequency ranges of the probes being used?
Is the equipment capable of detecting all relevant discontinuities called out by the customer's acceptance specifications?
Do the Eddy Current probe(s) meet the requirements called out by the customer?
Were all parts clean?
Were the parts inspected in accordance with the applicable procedure and/or technique sheet?
Was care taken to ensure that no adjustments were made to the equipment after standardization was completed that could affect inspection performance?
Were residual field strength measurements taken prior to inspection?
If required, were all parts demagnetized prior to performing inspection?

If ferromagnetic material or parts were inspected, was the reference standard, material or part properly demagnetized prior to inspection to ensure that a magnetic field of 1 gauss or less was present when tested with a residual field indicator (magnetometer)?
Is Eddy Current inspection performed on finished bearing components only?
Was the scanning increment used as defined by the technique/procedures?
Was the speed of the inspection the same as that used during the set-up of the equipment?
Were all equipment settings made during set-up left unchanged during the inspection?
If it was determined that there was an equipment malfunction, was the equipment repaired or replaced and the entire lot re-inspected?
If it was determined that there was residual magnetism present, was/were the rejected material/part(s) demagnetized and re-inspected?
If it was determined that the set-up or inspection steps were performed improperly, was the entire lot re-inspected following the appropriate corrective action?
Following the inspection of a lot of bearing components, was the standard re-run for verification purposes?
For repeatability, was the signal amplitude response obtained as by the technique/procedures?
If not, was appropriate corrective action taken to ensure that the inspection was performed properly and that the lot was re-inspected?
Is the reference standard representative of the part configuration being inspected, per technique/procedure?
Was the system checked if the inspection ran for more than four hours?
If required, did the inspector properly evaluate every indication and reject parts containing relevant indications that exceeded the acceptance limits?
Were all rejectable indications marked on the part and/or appropriately documented?
Was all pertinent paperwork traceable to the part?
Were the specific accept/reject criteria properly understood by the inspector?
Did the accept/reject criteria properly reflect the customer criteria?
If required was an adequate post process cleaning operation performed?
After inspection and appropriate cleaning, were parts properly protected from corrosion or damage?
Were the inspection personnel certified to the correct levels for the work they were performing?
Were all level 1 personnel observed performing ET operations properly supervised by a level II or level III personnel?
Are symbols and/or marking methods used to denote Eddy Current inspection status through paper router, shop traveler, etc?
Were all inspection results properly recorded and traceable to the parts?
